name: Brachyura Shambler
description: A Medium-sized monstrosity with potent grappling abilities and a fearsome appearance, characterized by its powerful claws.
memorable: Can inflict sewer plague disease, adding a lingering threat to encounters.
goals: To incapacitate and afflict opponents with its disease and grappling attacks.
relations: May be encountered alongside other monstrosities or in environments tainted by decay.
environment: Typically found in damp or urban areas, often near sewers or similar environments.
strengths: Exceptional physical attacks with grappling capabilities that can restrain foes.
weaknesses: Poor mental attributes lead to low Intelligence and Charisma.
attacks: Uses claw attacks to grapple opponents and can inflict acid damage with its diseased spit.
most_powerful_ability: Diseased Spit causes lingering effects, such as exhaustion and impaired healing.
senses: Possesses darkvision, allowing it to see in dim light as if it were bright light.
additional_information: Inflicts 7 points of acid damage with its Diseased Spit.
Grappling creates a significant tactical challenge for opponents.
Sewer plague symptoms manifest 1d4 days after exposure.
Targets remain grappled until they escape or the shambler releases them.
Damage resistance to bludgeoning mitigates some physical attacks.
test_queries: tough monster with debilitating claw attacks
monster that can infect with sewer plague
creature that grapples and restrains opponents
